quotes.quote: Everything of importance has been said before by somebody who did not discover it.
quotes.author: Alfred North Whitehead

quotes.quote: I have suffered a great deal from writers who have quoted this or that sentence of mine either out of its context or in juxtaposition to some incongruous matter which quite distorted my meaning , or destroyed it altogether.
quotes.author: Alfred North Whitehead

quotes.quote: The point of quotations is that one can use another's words to be insulting.
quotes.author: Amanda Cross

quotes.quote: Quotation, n: The act of repeating erroneously the words of another.
quotes.author: Ambrose Bierce

quotes.quote: One must be a wise reader to quote wisely and well.
quotes.author: Amos Bronson Alcott

quotes.quote: When a thing has been said and well, have no scruple. Take it and copy it.
quotes.author: Anatole France

quotes.quote: Be careful -- with quotations, you can damn anything.
quotes.author: Andre Malraux

quotes.quote: Write a wise saying and your name will live forever.
quotes.author: Anonymous

quotes.quote: It is unbecoming for young men to utter maxims.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: The wisdom of the wise, and the experience of ages, may be preserved by quotation.
quotes.author: Benjamin Disraeli

quotes.quote: A quotation in a speech, article or book is like a rifle in the hands of an infantryman. It speaks with authority.
quotes.author: Brendan Francis

quotes.quote: To be amused by what you read--that is the great spring of happy quotations.
quotes.author: C. E. Montague

quotes.quote: I never have found the perfect quote. At best I have been able to find a string of quotations which merely circle the ineffable idea I seek to express.
quotes.author: Caldwell O'Keefe

quotes.quote: I improve on misquotation.
quotes.author: Cary Grant

quotes.quote: The American people would not want to know of any misquotes that Dan Quayle may or may not make.
quotes.author: Dan Quayle

quotes.quote: People will accept your ideas much more readily if you tell them Benjamin Franklin said it first.
quotes.author: David H. Comins

quotes.quote: What's the use of a good quotation if you can't change it?
quotes.author: Doctor Who

quotes.quote: A facility for quotation covers the absence of original thought.
quotes.author: Dorothy L. Sayers

quotes.quote: I might repeat to myself slowly and soothingly, a list of quotations beautiful from minds profound - if I can remember any of the damn things.
quotes.author: Dorothy Parker

quotes.quote:
Some for renown, on scraps of learning dote,
And think they grow immortal as they quote.
quotes.author: Edward Young

quotes.quote: An epigram often flashes light into regions where reason shines but dimly.
quotes.author: Edwin P. Whipple

quotes.quote: If you have any doubts that we live in a society controlled by men, try reading down the index of contributors to a volume of quotations, looking for women's names.
quotes.author: Elaine Gill

quotes.quote: I often quote myself. It adds spice to my conversation.
quotes.author: George Bernard Shaw

quotes.quote: After all, all he did was string together a lot of old, well-known quotations.
quotes.author: H. L. Mencken

quotes.quote: Misquotation is, in fact, the pride and privilege of the learned. A widely- read man never quotes accurately, for the rather obvious reason that he has read too widely.
quotes.author: Hesketh Pearson

quotes.quote: Misquotations are the only quotations that are never misquoted.
quotes.author: Hesketh Pearson

quotes.quote: Life itself is a quotation.
quotes.author: Jorge Luis Borges

quotes.quote: A fine quotation is a diamond on the finger of a man of wit, and a pebble in the hand of a fool.
quotes.author: Joseph Roux

quotes.quote: What a good thing Adam had. When he said a good thing he knew nobody had said it before.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: I love quotations because it is a joy to find thoughts one might have, beautifully expressed with much authority by someone recognized wiser than oneself.
quotes.author: Marlene Dietrich
